Replies.Reply: Property of: Western Renaissance Pictures, Inc.
Screenplay by Sam Raimi and Ivan Raimi January 3, 1991 Registered with the Writers Guild of America, 1991 c 1991 by Sam and Ivan Raimi.  All rights reserved.
I first saw the damn thing at that blasted cabin. The Necronomicon.
The book awoke something dark in the woods.
It got into my hand and it went bad.
So I lopped it off at the wrist.
In order to rid myself of the foul thing, I read from a passage in the book that was supposed to open a hole.  A hole in Time that would send the Evil back. And it worked.
Take is easy now chief. I don't know how I got here and I'm not lookin' for any trouble.
Where the hell they put the stirrups on this thing!!??
GIDDYPU!
No!
Who wants to know?
You ain't leadin' but two things now, pal. Jack and shit.  And Jack left town.
Hey, I never even saw these assholes before..
Come on, you blasted piece of--
All right now. Who wants to be next?  Who wants some.
You want some more?  Huh?!
Now climb on those horses and get out of here.
GIDDYUP NOW!!  HYAAAH!
Bring me your hoo do man.
First you wanta kill me, now ya wanna kiss me.
Lady, just leave me alone.
They're mistaken.
Well what is it?  Can you send me back or not?
The Necronomicon. Yeah, that's the thing that got me here.
Me?  Now way, no day. Only place I'm goin' is home.
It's a trick.  Get an axe.

stares over the castle wall to the foreboding wasteland with apprehension.  The wind blows upon his hair. Sheila appears behind him. She drapes a grey garment over Ash. A magnificent cape. Ash draws her body close to his. He wraps the cape around her.  Together they stare off into the night, then turn to one another and kiss.

He wears an iron breastplate with the insignia of Arthur's army that compliments his new spring-powered iron hand.  His chainsaw juts from it's saddle holster on the horse's back.  Ash's cape billows as he rides.
What's going on?
Clatto Verata Nicto.  Okay.
Clatto Verata Nicto.
I got it.  I got it.  I know your damn words. All right?  Now you get this straight: I get the book, you send me back. That's the deal.
HAAAAAA!
rides out of the wall of mist. He finds himself on a trail leading into a thick forest.
Come on!  Come on!
Blasted piece of junk!
enters the Mill.
Anybody here?!
This place'll do for the night.
listens as the cabin CREAKS like an old ship beneath the force of the gale.
Damn this cold.
'least I won't freeze to death.
Easy, boy.
stares in disbelief, then the wind slams the front door of the Mill, halting Ash's view. Ash races for the Mill.
Ooops.
Nasty little thing's inside me.
emits a bark of LAUGHTER. He clutches as his chest.  Then his arm.  He rips back his shirt sleeve.
No!  Not the teeth!
Where the hell are ya!?
I can't see ya!!
No, no--not the poke--
Okay then.
Dear God, it's growing bigger!
I know better than to bury you whole.
with shovel in hand, drags a bloody burlap bag from the Mill.
Now you see what's what.  Man's body is his own personal property.
Hey, what's that you got on your face?
Rest in pieces.
This must be it. The cemetery.
Woah.  Wrong book.
tries to decide between them.  At first he's sure which one it is.  Then, chiding himself for being so easily duped, chooses the other.
Huh.
Okay.   The words.  Say the words.
Okay then.
A tiny figure among the gravestones which tremble and one by one are thrust from the earth.
Hey, wait a minute. Everything's cool!  I said the words!  I did!
Leave me alone!  Leave me aHUUU!
jerks backward, vomiting out the skeletal arm.  He tumbles to the ground.
Keep you damn filthy bones outta my mouth.
stares in horror at his evil self. All around, skeletons rip from the earth and shriek as they come back to life!
I'm through bein' their garbage boy.  I did my part of the bargain.
A tiny figure, rides toward the castle.
is led to the THREE WISEMEN.
Nothing. Here Ash produces the Necronomicon.
Yeah.  basically.
Well, maybe not every single syllable, no.  But basically I said them.  Yes.
Hey. We had a deal. You told me, you could clean this thing up, once I got you the book. You said there was a passage in there that could get rid of this thing and send me back.
You wanted the damn book. You got yer book. I did my part of the deal.
No!
Damn you!
Go ahead and run.  Run home and cry to mama.  I'm through runnin'.
We'll get Henry the Red and his men to fight with us.
Then you'll die.  Honor and all.
The Army of the Dead.
They're headed towards Arthur's castle. We need your help. Fight with us.
The only side I'm takin' is the one that's gonna stop those things.
Because after they finish with Arthur they'll come after you.
walks along, inspecting a line of forty medieval warriors who stand at attention. He halts before a warrior and stares hard at him. The Warrior glances towards Ash.
You eyeballin' me boy?
I can't hear you!
You squeekin' like a mouse!  Are you a mouse boy?!
Where you from, mouse?!
Only two things come from Perth: steers and queers. Which are you?
takes charcoal from a dead fire and chips of dried cow dung.
Arrows!
Fire!
He'll be here.
We said goodbye to Arthur.  Sure we had our problems.  But in the end, he was all right.
Peace was made between the two peoples.  And a new nation was formed.  They offered my a chance to stay among them and teach them.
rides off.
I had to find a place to crash.
with the aid of his horse, drags the Deathcoaster inside the cave.
YAHH!!
Places a black powder charge at the mouth of the cave.  He ignites the fuse and climbs into the car.
I locked the door.
uncorks the flask filled with the Wiseman's brew.
I closed my eyes.
I took a drink.
Dreams last lasted centuries.
climbs from the cave and steps into the sunlight.
My Lord Arthur, I believe he is the promised one, written of in the Necronomicon.
Only the Necronomicon has the power.  A power which we both require. It contains passages that can dispel the Evil from this place and return you to your time.
It is in a place far from here.
Now.  Will thou quest for the Necronomicon?
This is the edge of the land ruled by the Dark Spirit. This path will lead you to an unholy place. A cemetery. There, the Necronomicon awaits.
As thou removest the Book from it's cradle, you must recite these words.  Clatoo, verata, Nicto.
Repeat them.
Something is amiss.
The Necronomicon.  Quickly.
Did you bring the Necronomicon!
Just what?!
When you removed the Necronomicon from it's cradle, did you speak the words?
Did you speak the exact words?!
Dung eating fool!  Thou hast doomed us. When thou misspoke the words the Army of the Dead was awoke.
We did strike a bargain. I will return you to your own time as promised.
hands the flask of liquid to Ash.
The Book tells us that each drop allows a man to sleep a century.
He bleeds.  As a man bleeds.  The one written of in the Book would not bleed.
Likely, he is one of Henry's men.
LIEUTENANTS!  Fetch me the blackard.
Bring the prisoner!
To the castle!
Eye.  And fought valiantly.  But last night fell in battle to Duke Henry's men.

There is an Evil that has awakened in this land.  And whilst my people fight for their very souls against it, you, Duke Henry the Red, wage war on us. Your people are no better than the foul corruption that lies in the bowels of that pit!  May God have mercy on your souls.
Nay. Henry is my prisoners. He--
For that, I shall see you dead.
A moment.
The Wisemen were fools to believe that you were the Promised one.
How far from here?
Then these winged ones are only the first of them.
How will we stop an army of the dead at out castle walls?  How will you fight that?!  With more words?
We shall not stand in battle, alongside the likes of him. Our honor will not allow it.
Load!
Fire!
Powder!
Where is Henry?!
I think he will not. But know this.  No matter how this battle fares, I was wrong to think you a coward.
They're coming in. What now?!
Fall back!  Man the Parapet!  Protect the book or God save us all!
To the pit with the blackard!
Move along now!
Open the gates. The Promised one has returned!
We could be safe in the mountains.
a striking, blonde haired maiden, rushes into frame. She searches the faces of Arthur's warriors and grows concerned.
M'Lord Arthur!  Where is my brother?

Her face does not immediately register the grief.  She attempts to step forward but stumbles.  She steadies herself against the stone wall. Her eyes harden as she sees the first of the shackled prisoners: a semi-conscious Ash.
Foul thing!  A pox on your throat!
cries as the Village Women attempt to soothe her.
I pray thee to forgive me.  I believed thee one of Henry's men.
I think not.  I feel that there is reason for your being here.
I still believe that thou wilt help us.
I still have faith in thee. In my heart I know thou wilt still succeed.
M'Lord Ash!  Help me!
Don't touch me!  You foul thing!
The Promised one will come for you.
You sir, are not one of my vassals.  Who are you?
I am Henry the Red. Duke of Shale.
Aye. Into the pit with the bloodthirsty sons of whores!
erupts upward from the pit. Then silence.
There!  He's escaping!
I do not believe that he shall listen.
Stay your arms!
T'is the stranger who spared me from the pit. What brings you?
What of them?
So you are a vassal of Arthur now?
Why should I endanger my people to save my enemy?
It's rotted corpse rockets up from the water inches from Ash's face!

opens his mouth to allow a spoonful of food to enter.  No sooner has he swallowed then a piece of fruit is offered.  He waves it away with a satisfied burp and turns to drink from a goblet on wine, brought to his lips by a female hand.
YOU SHALL DIE!
The Evil lives.  Slay me and ten will rise to take my place.  All will die.  ALL WILL -
NECRONOMICON.  WE SHALL FEAST UPON YOUR SOUL, AND THEN THE SOUL OF MAN!
attaches the shock absorber spring to the iron hand.
rides slowly on through the darkening woods.

Characters.Character: TRACKING WITH ASH AND THE DOOR

Replies.Reply: as they are swept up at super speed in the grip of the Evil Force.  Ash is seen rocketing through the long hallway of the Shed, spinning head over heels.  Ash rips through other doors, taking them with him. Ash is now sandwiched between two doors as he flies through the air.
dip into Ash's mouth and clamps down upon a back molar.
raises a red hot fireplace poker and presses it against the right half of his body.
Why are you doing this?!
directs teams of skeletons to dig at the graves.
Dig!  Dig faster!  I want every black hearted, worm infested, son of a bitch that ever died in battle!
Why ain't you a sweet little thing?
Your gonna learn to live me missy.
Darlin' I'm gonna save him the trouble.
Who rules?!
Where are they keeping my book?
Excellent. Proceed.
You needn't bother.
You are now my captain. I will now allow anything to stop me from possessing the Necronomicon. Get me into that castle.
Arrows!
The book shall be mine!
You'll never get that Book. I will come back for you.
Huh?
blows open revealing Wiseman John.  He looks at the gathering storm with foreboding.
rips through the ground, punching Ash in the stomach.
galloping back the way he came. In the distance we see the cemetery. More bodies arise from the ground.
swings down.
The stranger has returned!  He's brought the book!
An army of the dead!  They have gathered in the wilderness and come this way.
But two days ride.
M'Lord!  A second division approaching from the South.
Perhaps we should go from this place while we can.
Yes!  To the mountains!  We must flee!
I'll stand by you.
yanks her to her feet.
look under the hood of the Delta 88, parked in the Blacksmith's shop.
is rung madly.  The signal for battle stations.
They're coming!  The Deadites approach!
M'Lord!  We are positioned on both fronts!
are wheeled into position.
RAM THE GATES!
fall to the courtyard. Villagers lift them away on stretchers.
Thou didst find me beautiful once.
swings his sword. Ash leaps over the blade. The Skeleton swings downward, and Ash side steps it.
You're finished.
I possess the Necronomicon. I've crushed your pathetic army. Now I'll have my vengeance!
Duke Henry's men!  They've come!
rockets up past camera, waving its boney arms. The burning satchel follows.
watch the funeral pyre sail off.  It's flickering flames play upon their faces.
lays sprawled on its side.  The time of mankind's death frozen on the cracked face of the clock.
